title: Introduction to TABASCO PEPPER: Plant Profile! (Capsicum frutescens)

tasks.task: they talk about planting seeds indoors about 8-10 weeks before the last frost. So the physical task there would be "Gardening: Seed Starting." But that's pretty general. Breaking it down further, when they are growing the seeds indoors, they need a temperature around 75-80°F for optimal germination. So perhaps "Sealing and maintaining indoor seed trays" at a certain temperature. But maybe that's too specific. Alternatively, the main task could be "Gardening: Starting Seeds Indoors" which subtasks would include setting up seed trays, watering, providing warmth if needed. Then once they're transplanted, that's another task. So maybe MAINTASK: Transplanting seedlings outside. Subtasks: Planting seedlings at 18-24 inches apart, ensuring temperatures are above 60°F, providing they need six hours of sunlight.
Visiting Terramater Gardens and engaging with the video content
